alert.note: Alert for Bollinger; Wayne (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 14 at 3:01AM CDT until August 14 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM CDT THIS MORNING FOR BOLLINGER AND NORTHERN WAYNE COUNTIES... At 301 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain in a band from Coldwater to Cascade to Grassy to Leopold and locations south of Marble Hill. Between 4 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Piedmont, Marble Hill, Sam A. Baker State Park, Cascade, Grassy, Lodi, Leopold, Zalma and Glenallen. This is an upgrade to a considerable flash flood threat. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
